column4: It's best to have a preferred date with some alternates. Doing so will give you a general idea as you decide budget, search for venues and sending save-the-date. Destination or local? Fall or spring?
Tutorial (How-to):
1. Take weather, seasoning, budget into account
2. Give yourself plenty of time to plan your dream wedding and don't rush it!
3. Come up with a preferred date and a few alternates
Resource (title1|url1,title2|url2,title3: How To Choose A Wedding Date In 7 Steps - Huffington Post|http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/02/10/wedding-date-planning-_n_4746723.html

column4: It helps you to establish the amount of money that you'll have available and to set priorities accordingly. Talk about who will pay for what with your partner and families.
Tutorial (How-to):
1. Figure out who's paying for the wedding
2. Estimate guest headcount
3. Get aware of a sample budget breakdown: 
     - Reception (Food, Rentals, and Site) 40% 
     - Flowers 5-10%
     - Photography/Videography 15% 
     - Attire, Beauty & Ring 10%
     - Entertainment 5%
     - Planner / Coordinator 10%
     - Miscellaneous (Invitations, Officiant, Favors, Etc.) 15%
Resource (title1|url1,title2|url2,title3: Wedding Budget Calculator - Jenn Lane Design|http://jennlanedesign.com/wedding-budget-calculator.php,Wedding Timeline and Budget - Brides|http://www.brides.com/wedding-answers-tools/wedding-timeline-budget

column4: It's not required but consider hiring one if you: have a busy job, or like the idea of a third person (expert) opinion.
Tutorial (How-to):
1. Research to find 5 finalists to schedule a talk by phone or in-person
2. Interview them with the questions:
    - How do you communicate with clients?
    - How many clients do you have in a year, and in my wedding month?
    - Do you work alone or with a team?
    - What additional fees do I need to know about?
Resource (title1|url1,title2|url2,title3:
Wedding Planning: 6 Crucial Questions To Ask A Wedding Planner
 - Huffington Post|http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/14/wedding-planning_n_1597953.html

column4: It is a chance to round up your very favorite people to surround you on the Big Day! They also provide you with assistance and emotional support during the planning!
Tutorial (How-to):
1. Wait to ask until you've set your general wedding date. Adding bridesmaids is a lot more fun than demoting them
2. Redefine the roles and number
3. Ask other friends and relatives to act as candlelighters, ushers, etc

column4: It sets the tone of your wedding - will affect a host of planning decisions, i.e. venues, invitations, attire and even floral decor.
Tutorial (How-to):
1.Discuss your favorite shade and bloom with your wedding party or planner
2.Consider the setting. Look at the colors used in your venue’s carpeting, drapery and decorations
3.Be prepared to have two different color themes if your ceremony and reception venue are very different

column4: The officiant verifies the legality of the marriage by examining state issued licenses and makes sure all of the appropriate documentation to perform your wedding.
Tutorial (How-to):
1. Choose your ceremony style and watch candidates perform ones
2. Ask fees, availability for rehearsal and wedding day
3. Ask for the sermon or an overview
4. Ask any restriction, i.e. music, attire,etc
5. Confirm payment schedule and sign contract

column4: It's the place you say "I do".

1. Browse and schedule appointments with sites and/or officiants
2. Ask if the site has an coordinator and any restriction, i.e. seating space, microphone

Tutorial (How-to):
1. Decide on the total guest count
2. Establish priority with families and create rules to make a cut, i.e. kids, out-of-town

column4: Keep your guests updated. Start by adding the story of how you met and got engaged. Guests can check the other essential info like venue details and hotels later.

2. Discover inspirations and DIY tips

column4: It is an official legal document of your love and commitment.

1. Get the wedding party together in person and go through everything
2. Send them the to-do list parts and make sure they know their responsibilities
3. Confirm any VIP toasts
